title: How to Name a Mob in Minecraft

steps.title: Gather the necessary materials for an anvil.
steps.content: Gather the necessary materials for an anvil. You'll need an anvil to customize your name tag later. To craft an anvil, you will need the following: Three iron blocks - Each iron block requires nine iron ingots, for a total of twenty-seven iron ingots needed. Four iron ingots - These bars bring the iron total to thirty-one. You can create iron ingots by adding iron ore, which is the grey stone with orange-brown spots, into a furnace that has coal in it.

steps.title: Open your crafting table.
steps.content: Open your crafting table. It will open to a three-by-three grid. If you haven't yet crafted a crafting table, you can do so by placing a plank of wood in each of your inventory's four crafting slots.

steps.title: Create an anvil.
steps.content: Create an anvil. To do so, you'll place the three iron blocks in the top row of the crafting table grid, three of the four iron ingots along the bottom row of the grid, and the final iron ingots in the center of the grid. Take the completed anvil from the slot on the left. On the PE version of Minecraft, tap the black anvil icon on the left side of the screen. On the console version of Minecraft, select the anvil icon in the "Structures" tab.

steps.title: Understand that you can't craft name tags.
steps.content: Understand that you can't craft name tags. You can only gather name tags in one of three ways: fishing, trading, and looting chests. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Craft a fishing rod.
steps.content: Craft a fishing rod. You'll need three sticks and two pieces of string to do so. You can also combine two damaged fishing poles to craft a working pole.

steps.title: Fish until you reel in a name tag.
steps.content: Fish until you reel in a name tag. To fish, you'll cast out a line by right-clicking (or tapping, or pressing the left trigger) while facing a body of water with your fishing pole equipped. When your pole's bobber dips below the surface of the water and you hear a splashing noise, you'll press the "Cast" button again. You'll likely catch a lot of fish and other junk before you reel in a name tag, since name tags are fairly rare. The Luck of the Sea enchantment can help.

steps.title: Speak to a villager about name tags.
steps.content: Speak to a villager about name tags. Villages are randomly generated structures situated around Minecraft's world. If you know of a village's location and you have plenty of emeralds, it may be faster for you to purchase a name tag than it is to fish for one. To speak to a villager, face them and then right-click, tap, or press the left trigger.

steps.title: Loot a dungeon, mineshaft, or woodland mansion.
steps.content: Loot a dungeon, mineshaft, or woodland mansion. Chests inside of these areas have a reasonably high chance of producing a name tag. Since these structures are randomly generated, this method of acquiring name tags is incredibly inefficient (and dangerous. You can cheat by using the locate command to search for structures.

steps.title: Make sure you're at least level one.
steps.content: Make sure you're at least level one. Your experience level, which is the green number near the bottom of your screen, must be at least one in order for you to craft a custom name tag.

steps.title: Place your anvil on the ground.
steps.content: Place your anvil on the ground. It will make a loud "clank" noise when you do so.

steps.title: Equip your name tag.
steps.content: Equip your name tag. To do so, open your inventory and move the tag to your character's hotbar, then select it. The tag will appear in your character's hand.

steps.title: Select the anvil.
steps.content: Select the anvil. This will open the anvil's crafting window with your name tag in place.

steps.title: Enter a name for your name tag.
steps.content: Enter a name for your name tag. You'll do this in the "Name" field at the top of the anvil's window. On console editions, you'll first have to select the "Name" field and press A or X' .

steps.title: Select the name tag.
steps.content: Select the name tag. Doing so will place it in your inventory.

steps.title: Equip your custom name tag.
steps.content: Equip your custom name tag. Once you see it in your hand, you're ready to assign a name to a mob. On console editions of Minecraft, you can simply select the tag and press Y or Î” .

steps.title: Locate an animal or a monster.
steps.content: Locate an animal or a monster. You'll want to take care whilst naming a hostile mob (e.g., a zombie), but naming animals like sheep or cows is a harmless task.

steps.title: Face a mob and select them.
steps.content: Face a mob and select them. As long as the name tag is in your hand, doing so will place a text box with your name tag's phrase in it above the mob's head.
